sens.vi: judge people by their actions, not by their words
sens.syn: act, deed, doing, exploit, feat, thing
sens.rel: accomplishment, achievement, attainment; adventure, experience; emprise, enterprise, initiative, undertaking; handiwork, performance, work; stunt, trick; activity, dealing; maneuver, measure, move, operation, procedure, proceeding, step, tactic; coaction

sens.mc: the unfolding of events in a dramatic or literary work
sens.vi: the mystery writer displays a sure hand in managing the novel's complicated but never incoherent action
sens.rel: subplot; arc, development; design, outline, plan, scheme; argument, mythos, subject, theme

sens.mc: a court case for enforcing a right or claim
sens.vi: filed an action in county court to recover his lawn mower from his neighbor, who claims he “gave” it to her
sens.rel: litigation; case, cause, complaint; counterclaim, countersuit, cross action, cross-claim

sens.mc: active fighting during the course of a war
sens.vi: the battalion saw action soon after it arrived in France
sens.rel: attack, fire, firefight, pitched battle, single combat; hostilities, operations, warfare; duty, service

sens.mc: the way or manner in which one conducts oneself
sens.vi: observing the actions of mice in various controlled settings helps scientists understand the effects of certain drugs
sens.syn: actions, address, bearing, comportment, conduct, demeanor, deportment, geste (also gest) [archaic]
sens.rel: etiquette, form, manners, mores, proprieties; p's and q's; amenity, civility, courtesy, decorum, politeness; air, attitude, carriage, poise, pose, posture, presence; aspect, look, mien; formality, protocol, rules; custom, habit, habitude, pattern, practice (also practise), trick, wont; convention, fashion, form, mode, style; affectation, attribute, characteristic, mark, trait; distinctiveness, oddity, peculiarity, singularity, strangeness, uniqueness, weirdness

sens.mc: readiness to engage in daring or difficult activity
sens.vi: the wilderness was tamed by men and women of action
sens.syn: action, aggressiveness, ambition, drive, go, hustle, initiative
sens.rel: grit, gumption, pluck, snap, spirit, spunk, starch; ambitiousness, killer instinct, overambitiousness; assertiveness, self-reliance; energy, hardihood, pep, vigor, vitality
sens.near: inactivity, inertia, passivity; diffidence, faintheartedness, timidity; hesitation, reluctance; indolence, laziness, lethargy

sens.mc: a small figure often of a human being used especially as a child's plaything
sens.vi: a collection of action figures of his favorite superheroes
sens.rel: rag doll; figure, figurine; handpuppet, marionette

sens.mc: a broken or irregular part of something that often remains incomplete
sens.vi: a piece of stone fell from the crumbling wall
sens.rel: cantle, shred, tatter; end, leftover, oddment, remainder, remnant, stub; portion, section, segment; chip, flake, shard, shatter, shiver, sliver, splinter; clipping, paring, shaving; atom, crumb, dribble, fleck, flyspeck, grain, granule, molecule, morsel, mote, nubbin, nugget, particle, patch, scruple, snip, snippet, speck, tittle

sens.mc: a literary, musical, or artistic production
sens.vi: presented a new interpretation of the piece by Mozart
sens.rel: classic, magnum opus, masterpiece, pièce de résistance, showpiece; model, outline, sketch; étude; canon, corpus, oeuvre

sens.mc: a portable weapon from which a shot is discharged by gunpowder
sens.vi: carrying a piece under his coat
sens.syn: arm, firearm, heat [slang], piece, small arm
sens.rel: derringer, forty-five (or .45), gat [slang], handgun, pistol, revolver, rod [slang], roscoe [slang], sidearm, six-gun, six-shooter, zip gun; self-loader, semiautomatic; blunderbuss, breechloader, culverin, fieldpiece, firelock, flintlock, harquebus (or arquebus), matchlock, musket, rifle, shotgun, smoothbore, twenty-two (or .22); AK-47, assault rifle, assault weapon, automatic, carbine, machine gun, machine pistol, repeater, submachine gun, tommy gun; speargun

sens.mc: something belonging to, due to, or contributed by an individual member of a group
sens.vi: believes his piece of the profits should be higher
sens.syn: allotment, allowance, cut, end, part, piece, portion, proportion, quota, slice, take
sens.rel: lot, ration; commission, percentage; member, partition, section, segment
sens.near: aggregate, composite, compound, pool, sum, total, totality; whole
